meanings.sent1: The new building was a superschool addition to our neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The students were proud to attend the superschool with top-notch facilities.
meanings.sent3: The superschool cafeteria served the most delicious lunches in town.
meanings.sent4: Her academic achievements made her the superschool star of the year.
meanings.sent5: The superschool's reputation for excellence attracted students from far and wide.

meanings.definition: To make a school superior in quality or performance.
meanings.sent1: The principal worked hard to superschool the curriculum and improve student outcomes.
meanings.sent2: Parents hoped the new program would superschool their children's educational experience.
meanings.sent3: The teachers decided to superschool the playground by adding new equipment.
meanings.sent4: The innovative teaching methods helped superschool the traditional learning environment.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to superschool the school's resources for better learning opportunities.
